text: Can y’all move these links (marked up in the _orange curly brace_) to the top level in the api docs? It took me way too long to find them

We actually specifically collapsed them together because the menu in the previous version of the docs got to be unusably long.

If you don’t mind, what steps did you take to try and find the various object APIs?  I want to see what we can do to make them more discoverable for you.
I was on <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/overview|this page> looking in the crm api menu for the contacts api
I guess I am just coming from a v2 api mindset. Maybe this will just take some getting used to
You won’t be the only one though. Appreciate the feedback!
Out of curiosity, did you try the search bar on the page?  If so, did that help you find the right API or not?  We were hoping search would solve some of those migration mindset issues

hey there! I was surprised earlier today when I find out there is no such thing as Tickets webhook API? I know tickets are "younger" than other records but I was 100% sure we could subscribed to tickets events....

If they don't exist, how come Zapier is able to offer a "New ticket property change" trigger??? They must use a webhook for that right?
I did, but the search var took me to the old api docs
ahh ok, we should be able to fix that. Thanks!
hey <@UFBNA9K9A> I'm sure you have something clever to say about this! Thanks :slightly_smiling_face:

Hey <@UDU6KEBFB>, I took a quick peak at the Zapier app and we use the get <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/tickets/get-ticket-changes|log of changes> endpoint to power that trigger. It’s just polling for you behind the scenes.
Supporting ticket webhooks is definitely on our radar, I’m just not sure exactly when
Ok. so I can set a cron job every day to get a log of changes for tickets as a workaround? Ma I getting this right?
Am*
is the value set to the changed property available in the response? is it possible to filter for tickets that are being closed...
or I will need to get the ticket by ID to see if they are closed?
re: cron job, yeah you right there, you can do it more frequently if you would like. You could do hourly if you wanted
the changes will be in the response, you cannot filter
if you would want to do filtering you need to use the Search API
ok great we'll look into this. Thanks !
<@U012TAH79BQ> FYI
